title: The Multi-faceted Aspects of Krishna | Sri Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa | SB 6.9.21 | 23.07.2024
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Taking shelter of the Supreme Lord brings actual fearlessness and therefore the demigods decided to take shelter of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker reads and explains a verse and purport from Srimad Bhagavatam about taking shelter of the Supreme Lord to overcome fear.

segments.key_quote: How Mother Yasoda can put me down when I am hungry and I am drinking her milk?
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the Damodara Lila, focusing on Krishna's anger at Yasoda for leaving him to tend to the boiling milk and his subsequent mischievous act of breaking the curd pot.

segments.key_quote: So, Krishna allowed himself to be captured by Yasoda Mai.
segments.summary: The speaker continues the Damodara Lila narration, describing Yasoda catching Krishna, his crying, her decision not to beat him, and his subsequent tying to the wooden mortar, leading to the liberation of Nalakuvara and Manigreeva.

segments.key_quote: She always knew that Krishna is the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
segments.summary: The speaker transitions to Krishna's later life and describes Kunti's prayers to Krishna before his departure to Dwaraka, emphasizing her understanding of Krishna as the Supreme Personality of Godhead.

segments.key_quote: The Time Factor is nothing but it is another aspect of yours.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Kunti's prayer, explaining Krishna's role as the Supreme Controller in the form of the Time Factor, highlighting the impartiality and all-encompassing control of time.

segments.key_quote: Death personified fears you. And what are you doing? You are crying in fear of Yashodamai.
segments.summary: The speaker continues discussing Kunti's prayers, focusing on the inconceivable nature of Krishna, who is feared by death personified yet afraid of Yashoda Mai.

segments.key_quote: Actually, This shows, The, The, The, Multifaceted personality that Krishna is.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Sukadeva Goswami also highlights Krishna's inconceivable nature, emphasizing the contrast between Krishna being feared by death and being afraid of his devotee, Yashoda.

segments.key_quote: God is not to be appreciated just as a very person to be feared.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how the fearful aspect of God is present in many religions, but Srimad Bhagavatam reveals Krishna's multifaceted personality, going on to describe Krishna's arrival at Kamsa's wrestling match.

segments.key_quote: All the people, Their eyes, Turned towards Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how different people in the stadium perceived Krishna upon his arrival, including the wrestlers, common men, women, Gopas, and Kamsa, each seeing a different aspect of him.

segments.key_quote: Inconceivable Nature, Of Krishna, Pervades, All his, Characteristics, And attributes.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the inconceivable nature of Krishna and how it pervades all his characteristics, linking it to Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's philosophy of simultaneous oneness and difference.

segments.key_quote: So this demonstrates the inconceivable nature of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of Ganga originating from Krishna's lotus feet to illustrate Krishna's inconceivable nature, emphasizing the importance of studying Srimad Bhagavatam and appreciating Srila Prabhupada's mercy in revealing these truths.
